title: Mushrooms & Spinach Orzo with Tomato Sauce
description: A fast stovetop pasta built around mushrooms, spinach, and a tomato sauce finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the orzo until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add mushrooms and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the spinach and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (tomato sauce). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.
text:
Mushrooms & Spinach Orzo with Tomato Sauce
A fast stovetop pasta built around mushrooms, spinach, and a tomato sauce finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
Italian-inspired
dinner
easy
Ingredients: orzo, spinach, onion, garlic, mushrooms, olive oil, salt, black pepper, crushed tomatoes, chili flakes
Instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the orzo until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the spinach and cook until just tender. Stir in the sauce base (tomato sauce). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed. Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.
Tags: low-carb, nut-free, one-pot, vegetarian
Keywords: comfort food, mushrooms, orzo, pasta, spinach, stovetop, tomato, weeknight

title: Beef Nachos with Avocado-Lime Sauce
description: A customizable nachos with beef, bell pepper, and a bold avocado-lime sauce. Great for meal prep or quick dinners.
instructions: Warm a skillet over medium heat with olive oil. Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add beef and season with cumin, smoked paprika, and salt. Cook until sizzling and well coated.
Stir in bell pepper and cook 3–5 minutes so it stays crisp-tender. Finish with lime juice.
Assemble nachos: layer rice, the seasoned filling, and your chosen sauce (avocado-lime sauce).
Add optional toppings like shredded lettuce, pickled onions, or extra cilantro. Serve immediately.

title: Medium Shrimp & Cauliflower Curry (spinach)
description: A cozy spinach curry featuring shrimp and cauliflower. Flexible for slow cooker cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add cauliflower and shrimp. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the cauliflower is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use slow cooker if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Chicken Garlic-Teriyaki Stir-Fry with Brown Rice
description: A fast, high-heat wok stir-fry featuring chicken, carrot, and eggplant in a garlic-teriyaki sauce.
instructions: Prep everything first: slice chicken and chop vegetables. Keep sauce ingredients ready.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat with neutral oil. Add the protein and sear until nearly cooked through.
Add garlic and ginger; stir 20–30 seconds. Toss in carrot and eggplant and stir-fry until bright and crisp-tender.
Pour in the garlic-teriyaki sauce. Stir until glossy and the protein is fully cooked.
Serve over brown rice. Top with sliced green onions and extra chili if you like.

title: Chili Mushrooms & Vegetable Chili
description: A comforting chili soup built with mushrooms and a trio of vegetables. Works well on the instant pot for batch cooking.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, carrot, and celery until softened, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Stir in spices (paprika/chili powder if using).
Add broth, mushrooms, and the chopped vegetables. Bring to a simmer.
Cook until everything is tender, 20–35 minutes (or use instant pot if you prefer hands-off cooking).
Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and finish with herbs or a squeeze of lemon.

title: Romaine Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
description: A bright salad built on romaine with a lemon vinaigrette. Includes add-ins like avocado, walnuts, quinoa for texture and flavor.
instructions: Add the greens to a large bowl. Layer in the chopped add-ins.
Whisk the dressing (lemon vinaigrette) ingredients in a small bowl until emulsified.

Taste and adjust with a pinch of salt, extra citrus, or a splash of vinegar.
Serve immediately, or keep dressing separate for meal prep.

title: Frittata
description: A frittata recipe designed for simple mornings. Includes make-ahead tips and flexible add-ins.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Sauté onion and garlic in an oven-safe skillet. Add the vegetables and cook until just tender.
Whisk eggs with milk, salt, and pepper. Pour into the skillet and stir gently to distribute vegetables.
Cook 2–3 minutes until edges start to set, then transfer skillet to the oven.
Bake 10–14 minutes until puffed and set in the center. Slice and serve.

breakfast
easy

Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Sauté onion and garlic in an oven-safe skillet. Add the vegetables and cook until just tender. Whisk eggs with milk, salt, and pepper. Pour into the skillet and stir gently to distribute vegetables. Cook 2–3 minutes until edges start to set, then transfer skillet to the oven. Bake 10–14 minutes until puffed and set in the center. Slice and serve.

title: Cinnamon Pudding with Blueberries
description: A simple pudding with cinnamon notes and blueberries for texture. Written as an original, test-friendly dessert document.
instructions: Whisk sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan. Slowly whisk in milk until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until thickened and bubbling.
Remove from heat; whisk in vanilla and flavoring.
Pour into cups. Cover and chill at least 2 hours.
Serve chilled with fruit or whipped cream.

title: Vanilla Cookies with Pecans
description: A simple cookies with vanilla notes and pecans for texture. Written as an original, test-friendly dessert document.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment.
Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla.
Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt just until combined.
Fold in pecans. Scoop dough into balls and space them out on the sheet.
Bake 9–12 minutes until edges are set. Cool before serving.

Add cauliflower and shrimp. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the cauliflower is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use instant pot if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Chicken & Garlic Rigatoni with Creamy Garlic Sauce
description: A fast one-pot pasta built around chicken, garlic, and a creamy garlic sauce finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the rigatoni until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the garlic and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (creamy garlic sauce). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

Bake 10–14 minutes until puffed and set in the center. Slice and serve.

title: Mushrooms & Garlic Linguine with Creamy Garlic Sauce
description: A fast stovetop pasta built around mushrooms, garlic, and a creamy garlic sauce finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the linguine until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add mushrooms and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the garlic and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (creamy garlic sauce). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

title: Mild Shrimp & Spinach Curry (lentil dal)
description: A cozy lentil dal curry featuring shrimp and spinach. Flexible for slow cooker cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.

Add spinach and shrimp. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the spinach is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use slow cooker if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Chicken & Zucchini Orzo with Mushroom Ragù
description: A fast stovetop pasta built around chicken, zucchini, and a mushroom ragù finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the orzo until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the zucchini and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (mushroom ragù). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

title: Mild Shrimp & Eggplant Curry (spinach)
description: A cozy spinach curry featuring shrimp and eggplant. Flexible for slow cooker cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add eggplant and shrimp. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the eggplant is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use slow cooker if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Mushrooms Spicy Gochujang Stir-Fry with Rice
description: A fast, high-heat stovetop stir-fry featuring mushrooms, sweet potato, and cauliflower in a spicy gochujang sauce.
instructions: Prep everything first: slice mushrooms and chop vegetables. Keep sauce ingredients ready.

Serve over rice. Top with sliced green onions and extra chili if you like.

A customizable nachos with chickpeas, zucchini, and a bold avocado-lime sauce. Great for meal prep or quick dinners.
Mexican-inspired
lunch
easy
Ingredients: garbanzo beans, rice, zucchini, onion, garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, lime juice, olive oil, salt, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips
Instructions: Warm a skillet over medium heat with olive oil. Sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add chickpeas and season with cumin, smoked paprika, and salt. Cook until sizzling and well coated. Stir in zucchini and cook 3–5 minutes so it stays crisp-tender. Finish with lime juice. Assemble nachos: layer rice, the seasoned filling, and your chosen sauce (avocado-lime sauce). Add optional toppings like shredded lettuce, pickled onions, or extra cilantro. Serve immediately.
Tags: dairy-free, gluten-free, nut-free, one-pot, vegan
Keywords: avocado-lime sauce, chickpeas, garbanzo, lime, nachos, rice, sheet pan, tacos, tex-mex, zucchini

title: Spicy Tofu & Eggplant Curry (lentil dal)
description: A cozy lentil dal curry featuring tofu and eggplant. Flexible for instant pot cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add eggplant and tofu. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the eggplant is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use instant pot if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Shrimp Ginger-Soy Stir-Fry with Brown Rice
description: A fast, high-heat one-pan stir-fry featuring shrimp, spinach, and broccoli in a ginger-soy sauce.
instructions: Prep everything first: slice shrimp and chop vegetables. Keep sauce ingredients ready.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat with neutral oil. Add the protein and sear until nearly cooked through.
Add garlic and ginger; stir 20–30 seconds. Toss in spinach and broccoli and stir-fry until bright and crisp-tender.
Pour in the ginger-soy sauce. Stir until glossy and the protein is fully cooked.
Serve over brown rice. Top with sliced green onions and extra chili if you like.

title: Creamy Chickpeas & Vegetable Soup
description: A comforting creamy soup built with chickpeas and a trio of vegetables. Works well on the slow cooker for batch cooking.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, carrot, and celery until softened, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Stir in spices (paprika/chili powder if using).
Add broth, chickpeas, and the chopped vegetables. Bring to a simmer.
Cook until everything is tender, 20–35 minutes (or use slow cooker if you prefer hands-off cooking).
Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and finish with herbs or a squeeze of lemon.

title: Mixed Greens Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
description: A bright salad built on mixed greens with a lemon vinaigrette. Includes add-ins like tomato, olives, strawberries for texture and flavor.
instructions: Add the greens to a large bowl. Layer in the chopped add-ins.
Whisk the dressing (lemon vinaigrette) ingredients in a small bowl until emulsified.
Drizzle dressing over the salad and toss gently.
Taste and adjust with a pinch of salt, extra citrus, or a splash of vinegar.
Serve immediately, or keep dressing separate for meal prep.

title: Chocolate Chip Pancakes
description: A pancakes recipe designed for simple mornings. Includes make-ahead tips and flexible add-ins.
instructions: Whisk dry ingredients in a bowl. In a second bowl, whisk milk, egg, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry just until no dry streaks remain; the batter can be slightly lumpy.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it.
Pour 1/4-cup portions of batter. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve warm with fruit, yogurt, or maple syrup.
text:

A pancakes recipe designed for simple mornings. Includes make-ahead tips and flexible add-ins.
American
breakfast
medium
Ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, milk, egg, butter, chocolate chips
Instructions: Whisk dry ingredients in a bowl. In a second bowl, whisk milk, egg, and melted butter. Combine wet and dry just until no dry streaks remain; the batter can be slightly lumpy. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it. Pour 1/4-cup portions of batter. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden. Serve warm with fruit, yogurt, or maple syrup.

title: Matcha Fruit Crisp with Pecans
description: A simple fruit crisp with matcha notes and pecans for texture. Written as an original, test-friendly dessert document.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Toss fruit with lemon juice and sugar in a baking dish.
Mix oats, flour, cinnamon, salt, and butter until crumbly.
Sprinkle topping over the fruit.
Bake 30–40 minutes until bubbling and golden on top.
Serve warm with yogurt or ice cream.

title: Japanese Chutney (Citrus style)
description: A versatile chutney with a citrus profile, designed as a standalone condiment document for search experiments.
instructions: Combine fruit, onion, vinegar, sugar, and spices in a saucepan.
Simmer over low heat until thick and jammy, 20–30 minutes.
Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Cool completely; the flavor develops as it rests.
Serve with curries, cheese boards, or grilled meats.

title: Chicken & Carrot Linguine with Creamy Garlic Sauce
description: A fast one-pot pasta built around chicken, carrot, and a creamy garlic sauce finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the linguine until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the carrot and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (creamy garlic sauce). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours, until thickened.
Top with fruit or coconut and serve chilled.

title: Lemon Pudding with Chocolate Chips
description: A simple pudding with lemon notes and chocolate chips for texture. Written as an original, test-friendly dessert document.
instructions: Whisk sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan. Slowly whisk in milk until smooth.

Pour into cups. Cover and chill at least 2 hours.
Serve chilled with fruit or whipped cream.

title: Chickpeas & Spinach Fusilli with Spicy Arrabbiata
description: A fast one-pot pasta built around chickpeas, spinach, and a spicy arrabbiata finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the fusilli until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add chickpeas and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the spinach and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (spicy arrabbiata). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.

title: Chocolate Chip Pancakes
description: A pancakes recipe designed for simple mornings. Includes make-ahead tips and flexible add-ins.
instructions: Whisk dry ingredients in a bowl. In a second bowl, whisk milk, egg, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry just until no dry streaks remain; the batter can be slightly lumpy.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it.
Pour 1/4-cup portions of batter. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve warm with fruit, yogurt, or maple syrup.

title: Shrimp & Garlic Rigatoni with Lemon-Herb Olive Oil
description: A fast stovetop pasta built around shrimp, garlic, and a lemon-herb olive oil finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the rigatoni until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the garlic and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (lemon-herb olive oil). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

Add chickpeas and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the tomato and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (pesto). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

title: Medium Tofu & Sweet Potato Curry (tomato spice)
description: A cozy tomato spice curry featuring tofu and sweet potato. Flexible for slow cooker cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add sweet potato and tofu. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the sweet potato is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use slow cooker if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

Pour 1/4-cup portions of batter. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve warm with fruit, yogurt, or maple syrup.

title: Chickpeas & Carrot Orzo with Mushroom Ragù
description: A fast stovetop pasta built around chickpeas, carrot, and a mushroom ragù finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the orzo until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add chickpeas and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the carrot and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (mushroom ragù). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

title: Mushrooms & Eggplant Spaghetti with Creamy Garlic Sauce
description: A fast stovetop pasta built around mushrooms, eggplant, and a creamy garlic sauce finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add mushrooms and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the eggplant and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (creamy garlic sauce). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

title: Shrimp & Tomato Orzo with Lemon-Herb Olive Oil
description: A fast stovetop pasta built around shrimp, tomato, and a lemon-herb olive oil finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the orzo until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the tomato and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (lemon-herb olive oil). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

Pour 1/4-cup portions of batter. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve warm with fruit, yogurt, or maple syrup.

title: Spicy Lentils & Cauliflower Curry (spinach)

instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.

Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Chicken & Spinach Fusilli with Spicy Arrabbiata
description: A fast one-pot pasta built around chicken, spinach, and a spicy arrabbiata finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the fusilli until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the spinach and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (spicy arrabbiata). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

description: A comforting brothy soup built with lentils and a trio of vegetables. Works well on the slow cooker for batch cooking.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, carrot, and celery until softened, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Stir in spices (paprika/chili powder if using).
Add broth, lentils, and the chopped vegetables. Bring to a simmer.
Cook until everything is tender, 20–35 minutes (or use slow cooker if you prefer hands-off cooking).
Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and finish with herbs or a squeeze of lemon.

title: Granola
description: A granola recipe designed for simple mornings. Includes make-ahead tips and flexible add-ins.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Line a sheet pan with parchment.
Mix oats, nuts, seeds, spices, and salt in a large bowl.
Stir in brown sugar and olive oil until everything is evenly coated.
Spread into an even layer and bake 20–30 minutes, stirring once halfway, until golden.
Cool completely, then mix in dried fruit. Store airtight and serve with yogurt or milk.

title: Chickpeas & Garlic Rigatoni with Tomato Sauce
description: A fast one-pot pasta built around chickpeas, garlic, and a tomato sauce finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the rigatoni until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add chickpeas and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the garlic and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (tomato sauce). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

title: Chicken Burrito Bowl with Chipotle-Lime Crema
description: A customizable burrito bowl with chicken, corn, and a bold chipotle-lime crema. Great for meal prep or quick dinners.
instructions: Warm a skillet over medium heat with olive oil. Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add chicken and season with cumin, smoked paprika, and salt. Cook until sizzling and well coated.
Stir in corn and cook 3–5 minutes so it stays crisp-tender. Finish with lime juice.
Assemble burrito bowl: layer brown rice, the seasoned filling, and your chosen sauce (chipotle-lime crema).
Add optional toppings like shredded lettuce, pickled onions, or extra cilantro. Serve immediately.

title: Medium Chicken & Cauliflower Curry (tomato spice)
description: A cozy tomato spice curry featuring chicken and cauliflower. Flexible for stovetop cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add cauliflower and chicken. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the cauliflower is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use stovetop if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Beef Ginger-Soy Stir-Fry with Ramen Noodles
description: A fast, high-heat one-pan stir-fry featuring beef, eggplant, and garlic in a ginger-soy sauce.
instructions: Prep everything first: slice beef and chop vegetables. Keep sauce ingredients ready.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat with neutral oil. Add the protein and sear until nearly cooked through.
Add garlic and ginger; stir 20–30 seconds. Toss in eggplant and garlic and stir-fry until bright and crisp-tender.
Pour in the ginger-soy sauce. Stir until glossy and the protein is fully cooked.
Serve over ramen noodles. Top with sliced green onions and extra chili if you like.

Cool completely, then mix in dried fruit. Store airtight and serve with yogurt or milk.

title: Shrimp & Sweet Potato Rigatoni with Mushroom Ragù
description: A fast one-pot pasta built around shrimp, sweet potato, and a mushroom ragù finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the rigatoni until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the sweet potato and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (mushroom ragù). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add eggplant and lentils. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the eggplant is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use stovetop if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Shrimp & Kale Linguine with Spicy Arrabbiata
description: A fast one-pot pasta built around shrimp, kale, and a spicy arrabbiata finish. Designed for weeknights and easy leftovers.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the linguine until al dente, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant, about 2–3 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until warmed through and lightly browned. Stir in the kale and cook until just tender.
Stir in the sauce base (spicy arrabbiata). Simmer 5–8 minutes; loosen with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss in the drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Finish with herbs or cheese if desired and serve hot.

title: Beef Tacos with Avocado-Lime Sauce
description: A customizable tacos with beef, zucchini, and a bold avocado-lime sauce. Great for meal prep or quick dinners.
instructions: Warm a skillet over medium heat with olive oil. Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add beef and season with cumin, smoked paprika, and salt. Cook until sizzling and well coated.
Stir in zucchini and cook 3–5 minutes so it stays crisp-tender. Finish with lime juice.
Assemble tacos: layer quinoa, the seasoned filling, and your chosen sauce (avocado-lime sauce).
Add optional toppings like shredded lettuce, pickled onions, or extra cilantro. Serve immediately.

title: Medium Lentils & Cauliflower Curry (lentil dal)
description: A cozy lentil dal curry featuring lentils and cauliflower. Flexible for stovetop cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add cauliflower and lentils. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the cauliflower is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use stovetop if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.

title: Beef Spicy Gochujang Stir-Fry with Brown Rice
description: A fast, high-heat one-pan stir-fry featuring beef, zucchini, and green beans in a spicy gochujang sauce.
instructions: Prep everything first: slice beef and chop vegetables. Keep sauce ingredients ready.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat with neutral oil. Add the protein and sear until nearly cooked through.
Add garlic and ginger; stir 20–30 seconds. Toss in zucchini and green beans and stir-fry until bright and crisp-tender.
Pour in the spicy gochujang sauce. Stir until glossy and the protein is fully cooked.
Serve over brown rice. Top with sliced green onions and extra chili if you like.

Pour in the spicy gochujang sauce. Stir until glossy and the protein is fully cooked. Serve over brown rice. Top with sliced green onions and extra chili if you like.

title: Chili Lentils & Vegetable Chili
description: A comforting chili soup built with lentils and a trio of vegetables. Works well on the one-pot for batch cooking.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, carrot, and celery until softened, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Stir in spices (paprika/chili powder if using).
Add broth, lentils, and the chopped vegetables. Bring to a simmer.
Cook until everything is tender, 20–35 minutes (or use one-pot if you prefer hands-off cooking).
Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and finish with herbs or a squeeze of lemon.

title: Arugula Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
description: A bright salad built on arugula with a lemon vinaigrette. Includes add-ins like feta, quinoa, tomato for texture and flavor.
instructions: Add the greens to a large bowl. Layer in the chopped add-ins.
Whisk the dressing (lemon vinaigrette) ingredients in a small bowl until emulsified.
Drizzle dressing over the salad and toss gently.
Taste and adjust with a pinch of salt, extra citrus, or a splash of vinegar.
Serve immediately, or keep dressing separate for meal prep.

title: Breakfast Burrito
description: A breakfast burrito recipe designed for simple mornings. Includes make-ahead tips and flexible add-ins.
instructions: Warm a skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and bell pepper until softened.
If using potatoes, cook them until tender and lightly browned; then push aside.
Add eggs (or crumbled tofu) and season with cumin and salt. Scramble until set.
Warm tortillas briefly, then fill with the scramble, beans/sausage, salsa, and cheese if using.
Roll tightly into burritos. Serve right away or wrap for a make-ahead breakfast.
text:

Ingredients: tortillas, eggs, breakfast sausage, onion, bell pepper, salsa, cumin, salt

Add eggs (or crumbled tofu) and season with cumin and salt. Scramble until set. Warm tortillas briefly, then fill with the scramble, beans/sausage, salsa, and cheese if using. title: Vanilla Pudding with Chocolate Chips
description: A simple pudding with vanilla notes and chocolate chips for texture. Written as an original, test-friendly dessert document.
instructions: Whisk sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan. Slowly whisk in milk until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until thickened and bubbling.
Remove from heat; whisk in vanilla and flavoring.
Pour into cups. Cover and chill at least 2 hours.
Serve chilled with fruit or whipped cream.

title: Caribbean Vinaigrette (Herb style)
description: A versatile vinaigrette with a herb profile, designed as a standalone condiment document for search experiments.
instructions: Add acid, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper to a jar.
Pour in olive oil, cover, and shake vigorously until emulsified.
Taste and adjust: more acid for brightness, more oil for softness.
Use immediately or refrigerate up to 5 days.
Bring to room temp and shake again before serving.

title: Spicy Shrimp & Sweet Potato Curry (tomato spice)
description: A cozy tomato spice curry featuring shrimp and sweet potato. Flexible for slow cooker cooking and great with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook onion until golden at the edges, 6–8 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger; stir for 30 seconds. Add garam masala, turmeric, and cumin to bloom the spices.
Add sweet potato and shrimp. Stir to coat, then pour in tomatoes/broth (and coconut milk if using).
Simmer gently until the sweet potato is tender and the sauce thickens, 15–25 minutes (or use slow cooker if preferred).
Season with salt. Serve over rice and finish with herbs, lime, or yogurt if desired.
